page.title: 12The A75 Euroroute-3
page.content:
factors amount to is that the value of your property is depleted considerably if you live along the A75.
The local councils have recognised this though and have slightly reduced the rates of people living on the Euroroute.
There have been many attempts to try and solve the problem. Groups have campaigned for years for{by_passes, {reduced speed limits}and{improved {roads.}The authorities don't seem to realise the scale of the problem and have been very slow to act.
The facts are that the A75 was never built to be a Euroroute and is still in no condition to be one. When you see 38 ton lorries speeding through small country villages,along narrow
